column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=— Prologue —
#Text=It had taken only a matter of hours for the Kethlan system to become a tumbling sea of debris ; the twisted and burnt-out remnants of a once glorious Imperial nation .
#Text=An empire whose costly mistakes would for many years to come echo into every corner of the known galaxy .
#Text=And with those mistakes would come death to billions of innocent , unsuspecting lives .
#Text=A starfighter hurtled through the scattered metal , the pilot desperate to find a way to stop himself from joining the ever growing population of this interstellar graveyard .
#Text=Jacques Chalmers was not alone in his frustration with the current situation , but he was doubtless one of the most panicked .
#Text=He tried to steady himself as he began cycling once again through the available display options for his starfighter 's radar system .
#Text=His anxiety continued to grow with each passing second , every change of the screen doing nothing to abate it .
#Text=He stopped midway through the calibration and glanced out of his cockpit .
#Text=The scene was the same as it had been a few moments ago and it brought him no comfort .
#Text=He could n't count the number of capital ships that dominated the Enemy 's frontline .
#Text=Twenty ?
#Text=Thirty ?
#Text=Fifty ?
#Text=In his years of service to the Imperial Naval Forces he had never seen anything like it , not even in archive war footage .
#Text=The enormous forms of the battleships loomed like giants atop a hill , staring down upon a tiny village below .
#Text=Then there were the Enemy starfighters themselves : hundreds at least , swarming about like a huge wall of locusts .
#Text=Knowing that he had already been flying straight for longer than was advisable , Chalmers altered his course to attempt to throw off any pursuers .
#Text=* * *

#Text=Not long before he had been standing on the flight deck of his deployment carrier , amongst the other pilots , his heart pumping in his ears , his hands sweating as he awaited the order to board his fighter .
#Text=Chalmers saw his friends run forward as their names were called out , scrambling into cockpits , pulling on helmets and performing last-minute safety checks .
#Text=Though most hid it well , he was convinced they were all as nervous and scared as he was - knowing they could well be speeding only to their own deaths .
#Text=As he watched his friends ' fighters hurtle down the catapult , his commanding officer had addressed the last remaining pilots still standing on the flight deck .
#Text=“ Right , listen up , ” he started .
#Text=“ This is where we must make our stand .
#Text=The Enemy can not be allowed to advance any further .
#Text=Tonight we fight the battle for Kethlan and for the Imperium ; the battle for our survival .
#Text=Hundreds of millions of lives are depending on our actions here .
#Text=Make them proud ! ”
#Text=Hundreds of millions ? thought Chalmers .
#Text=Is that all that 's left ?
#Text=A few months ago it was billions .
#Text=This day had crept ever closer as cities , planets and then entire star systems had fallen to the Enemy ; to those damned Pandorans ; to the Senate 's mistake .
#Text=How many of his friends had he lost over these last few terrible months ?
#Text=Had they died fast or were they now suffering a fate far worse . . ?
#Text=As his CO continued to pump them up for the critical battle , Chalmers ' head was filled with visions of row upon row of black-clad soldiers .
#Text=A white emblem resided on their right arms and left breast , an all-encompassing full black helmet upon their heads , its smooth form negating all facial features .
#Text=Two bright red oval spheres were set into an eye-level groove that ran all around , the “ eyes ” themselves slanted into a menacing and intimidating scowl .
#Text=One of the soldiers turned to face him , the ruby-like eyes seeming to pierce his very soul .
#Text=He felt his hand tighten on the flight helmet he held , swallowing hard .
#Text=“ Daniels ! Peterson ! Foster ! Brown ! Rye ... ” a voice called out above the other sounds that filled the flight deck .
#Text=Feet moved and Chalmers felt his stomach lurch .
#Text=His name would be called soon .
#Text=He felt a sense of doom .
#Text=If the Empire could not stop the Enemy before , what hope did they have now ?
#Text=The Enemy 's power had grown exponentially and they had crushed everything in their path with harrowing little effort .
#Text=Chalmers was feeling forced to accept the truth : they were all that was left of the Imperial Naval Forces .
#Text=This was a battle that could not be won ; not now , not ever .
#Text=“ ... Tyler ! Flynn ! Chalmers ! King ! Golden ! Blair ... ”
#Text=At the sound of his name , Chalmers felt himself move robotically , his mind screaming in protest against what his legs were doing .
#Text=He ran over to the waiting starfighter , threw on his helmet and begun ascending the ladder into the cockpit .

#Text=Zombie-like he sank down into the seat , watching as if from outside his body as his hands buckled him in , his fingers flip switches , press buttons , acknowledge questions and confirmations on the screens before him .
#Text=Moments later , his craft was taxied to the catapult and before long he 'd found himself out in space and into the thick of battle .
#Text=At that moment , his worst fears had not only been altogether realised , but far exceeded .
